Grain.Do: Warm, light, and dry grains like barley (1/2 cup cooked), quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), and millet (1/2 cup cooked). Opt for whole grains. Consider smaller portions of oats (1/4 cup dry).
Grain.Dont: Heavy, dense grains like rice (especially white rice), wheat (in large quantities), and refined flour products. Avoid processed cereals.

Legume.Do: Light and easily digestible legumes like split mung beans (1/4 cup cooked), red lentils (1/4 cup cooked), and adzuki beans (1/4 cup cooked). Cooked until very soft.
Legume.Dont: Heavy, gas-producing legumes like black beans, chickpeas, and kidney beans. Avoid raw or undercooked legumes.

Veg.Do: Bitter and pungent vegetables like bitter gourd (1/2 cup cooked), radish (1/2 cup cooked), and cruciferous vegetables like cauliflower (1/2 cup cooked) and broccoli (1/2 cup cooked) prepared steamed or lightly sautéed. Cooked carrots and sweet potatoes in small amounts (1/4 cup).
Veg.Dont: Sweet, heavy, and sour vegetables like potatoes, sweet corn, tomatoes, cucumbers, and zucchini. Avoid raw vegetables.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (1/2 tsp fresh or dried), black pepper (pinch), turmeric (1/4 tsp), cinnamon (1/4 tsp), cardamom (pinch), and cumin (1/4 tsp). Use in moderation.
Spices.Dont: Excessive use of cooling spices like coriander and fennel in large quantities. Avoid very pungent or overly spicy spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked bitter greens like dandelion greens (1/2 cup cooked), spinach (1/2 cup cooked), and fenugreek leaves (1/2 cup cooked). Steamed or lightly sautéed.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens. Large quantities of sweet leafy greens.

Oil.Do: Light and warming oils like mustard oil (1 tsp), sesame oil (1 tsp), or ghee (if used, 1 tsp, though less ideal for vegan). Use sparingly for cooking.
Oil.Dont: Heavy oils like coconut oil and olive oil in large amounts. Fried foods.

Fruits.Do: Pungent and astringent fruits like apples (1/2 medium, cooked or baked), pears (1/2 medium, cooked), berries (1/4 cup), and pomegranate seeds (1/4 cup). Consume in moderation and ideally cooked.
Fruits.Dont: Very sweet, sour, and heavy fruits like bananas, mangoes, avocados, and melons. Avoid fruits as a standalone meal.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Small quantities of warming nuts like walnuts (3-4 halves), almonds (3-4 blanched), and dried ginger (very small piece). Soak almonds overnight.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Heavy nuts like cashews and pistachios. Excessive amounts of any nuts or dates.

Condiments.Do: Digestive chutneys made with ginger, mint, and spices in small amounts. Small amounts of Ayurvedic herbal formulations for digestion as advised by a practitioner.
Condiments.Dont: Sour or heavy condiments. Fermented foods in large quantities.
